text: When a function is called for the first time in Julia, the function is compiled. Is it correct that this compiled version is only stored for the current Julia session.. so restarting Julia makes Julia forget all compiled functions.. or is anything saved to disk?

elements.text: When a function is called for the first time in Julia, the function is compiled. Is it correct that this compiled version is only stored for the current Julia session.. so restarting Julia makes Julia forget all compiled functions.. or is anything saved to disk?

text: ok.. so when I run a Julia script from terminal many times with different arguments, then there is an (unnecessary?) compilation overhead each time

elements.text: ok.. so when I run a Julia script from terminal many times with different arguments, then there is an (unnecessary?) compilation overhead each time

text: yeah. Julia works best in an interactive manner for best performance.
